description.narrative: Étendre le système d’aires protégées (AP) géré par le Niger dans le biome saharien en appliquant des approches efficaces de gestion des Aires Protégées et en créant des corridors de migration de la faune.

4 Improved financial sustainability of PA management agency measured by increased scores of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard

Scorecard Component 2 Business planning
Scorecard Component 1 Tools for revenue generation

comment.narrative:
Comp 1

Target met for all components and for the total score

The increase of financial sustainability score is due to National PA financing strategies Training and support networks to enable PA managers to operate more costeffectively Setting and establishment of user fees across the PA system and Operational concessions within PAs

Not possible to assess quantifiable progress towards target because there has been no recent applications of the scorecard which are specific to the Saharan Biome
The exercise should be vetted by the final evaluation planed in september 2015

description.narrative:
9 Number of communes in which community members benefit from sport hunting revenue in designated community hunting zones in the Gran Corridor
NOTE ON LOGFRAME CHANGE 2014
Indicator amended Refer to 2014 reporting For an explanation Indicator 9 was previous formulated as follows
9 Number of communes in which community managers receive sport hunting revenue from community hunting areas contiguous to Gadabedji

comment.narrative: Not much progress made towards the target During the year 2015 hunting activities are low and absents in some cases Therefore the communities have not benefited from the income generated by this activity The contiguous communes to Gadabedji PA are eg not yet ready to support hunting activities The objective for now is to create favorable conditions for the restoration of fauna species which have disappeared before

Not much progress made towards the target During the year 2015 hunting activities are low and absents in some cases Therefore the communities have not benefited from the income generated by this activity The contiguous communes to Gadabedji PA are eg not yet ready to support hunting activities The objective for now is to create favorable conditions for the restoration of fauna species which have disappeared before

description.narrative: 6 Improved PA management effectiveness at two pilot sites Termit Gadabedji for general management and business planning as measured by increases in the METT scores

comment.narrative: METT Scores out of total possible of 102 points Gadabedji 32 points 31 Termit 54 points 53

Scores expressed in percetage terms increase by at least 10 in Termit and 30 in Gadabedji Indicatively Gadabedji 41 Termit 58
NOTE on LOGFRAME REVISION because the METT total possible points have changed in the past and may change in the future it is best to consider the targets as increases in the percentage results rather than absolute numbers

Target achieved Gadabedji 58 Termit 69 The increase in the level of score METT is due to the fact that there was some significant efforts in terms of training and capacity building of the project staff particularly those in charge of PA management Also the Government has appointed a huge number of Staff on the field to reinforce the protection and rehabilitation of natural resources as well as to boost biodiversity conservation within the Saharan biome Moreover the change occurred at the head of Termit Protected Management Unit brought a positive change as the activities implementation on the field a permanent team is actually present on the field at Tesker monitoring conservation activities and preventing poaching within the saharian biome

Scores expressed in percetage terms increase by at least 10 in Termit and 30 in Gadabedji Indicatively Gadabedji 41 Termit 58
NOTE on LOGFRAME REVISION because the METT total possible points have changed in the past and may change in the future it is best to consider the targets as increases in the percentage results rather than absolute numbers

Target achieved Gadabedji 58 Termit 69 The increase in the level of score METT is due to the fact that there was some significant efforts in terms of training and capacity building of the project staff particularly those in charge of PA management Also the Government has appointed a huge number of Staff on the field to reinforce the protection and rehabilitation of natural resources as well as to boost biodiversity conservation within the Saharan biome Moreover the change occurred at the head of Termit Protected Management Unit brought a positive change as the activities implementation on the field a permanent team is actually present on the field at Tesker monitoring conservation activities and preventing poaching within the saharian biome

description.narrative: 3 Strategically important natural habitats key relevance for faunal migration and transhumance within the Northern Niger Faunal Corridor of 1269 million hectares of Saharan landscape enjoy conservation through participatory sustainable land use systems and begin to reestablish conditions needed for future connectivity between the reserves of Gadabedji Termit and AírTénéré
13 Number of PDC PDGDRN Schema damenagement foncier which integrates biodiversity conservation needs

comment.narrative:
At least 20 of communes within the corridor
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
We made a slight correction to the formulation here It should read commune not community

Making progress but target not yet achieved The Project Management Units carried out assessment activities within the communities during which some local structures for biodiversity conservation were identified and their needs in terms of capacity building were registered Also during the reporting period 1 PAGC Community Management Plan and 1 PDC Community Development Plan have been developed in Gadabedji Forest reserve and three PDC 1 in Tesker 1 in NGourti and 1 in Tenhya have been reviewed in order to integrate biodiversity conservation needs

At least 20 of communes within the corridor
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
We made a slight correction to the formulation here It should read commune not community

description.narrative: 12 Critical habitats and key natural resources grazing lands water for wild herbivores and transhumant livestock are stabilizedimproved verified through remote sensing and complemented by groundtruthing

comment.narrative:
The following zones containing critical habitats and key natural resources have been identified in 20134 Parts of these zones could be proposed for having landsue stabilised and the structure and functions of ecosystems improved through either rehabilitation or restoration
Zone GadafawaTaguedoufat 6131894131 ha
Zone centrale 4199770564 ha
Zone des dilias 2791825861ha
Zone des vallées 1607798475 ha
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014
For the 2013 PIR the baseline for this indicator said Will be identified during PDC elaboration revision
We have made progress in establishing a meaningful baseline for this indicator

At least 30 of identified critical habitats are stabilizedimproved
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014
For the 2013 PIR the target for this indicator was 30 We consider this a large area for habitat rehabilitation but not necessarily for landuse stabilisation We may adjust it in 2015 when the process is more advanced
We have made progress in establishing a meaningful target for this indicator but more work is needed

Progress made in identifying critical habitats which is an initial but essential step towards the target The study on the definition and the cartography of the Corridors the identification of natural habitats gave the opportunity to gather some information on the state of the critical habitats within the project zones The sites which qualify as critical habitats containing key natural resources for wild herbivores and transhumant livestock are Zone GadafawaTaguedoufat 6131894131 ha Zone centrale 4199770564 ha Zone des dilias 2791825861ha Zone des vallées 1607798475 ha Actions taken by the project to stabilizeimprove critical habitats and key natural resources are figtht against bush fires dunes fixation and water points management

At least 30 of identified critical habitats are stabilizedimproved

description.narrative: 2 Estimated populations of Addax in Nigers Saharan biome are maintained stable

comment.narrative: Approx 200
Approx 200 numbers maintained

Target of numbers maintained is considered achieved The estimated number of addax is still around 200 in the project zone Meanwhile there are some exchanges with the international institutions CMS SCF to carry out an aerial survey of the zone in near future This will enable to have sufficient information on the fauna species within the Saharan biome
Approx 200 numbers maintained
